sub_topic: Calculation of coefficient of performance of a heat pump
message_1: Calculate the coefficient of performance (COP) of a heat pump that operates between 10°C and 30°C, and has a heat output of 10 kW while consuming 3 kW of electricity.
message_2:
The coefficient of performance (COP) of a heat pump is defined as the ratio of the heat output (Q_out) to the work input (W_in). In this case, the heat output is 10 kW, and the work input is 3 kW. So, the COP can be calculated as follows:

COP = Q_out / W_in

Plugging in the given values:

COP = 10 kW / 3 kW
COP = 3.33

Therefore, the coefficient of performance of the heat pump is 3.33. This means that for every 1 kW of electricity consumed, the heat pump transfers 3.33 kW of heat from the colder reservoir to the warmer one.
